org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.utils

Class SimpleFTPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.utils.SimpleFTPClient

  • public class SimpleFTPClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple client for FTP wrapping FTPClient. It always uses passive mode since it is targeted for use in Android.
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini
    See Also:
    FTPClient

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleFTPClient

        public SimpleFTPClient(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.String host,
                       int port)
        Create a new SimpleFTPClient instance with given credentials and host information.
        Parameters:
        username - the username to use when authenticating to the FTP server.
        password - the password to use when authenticating to the FTP server.
        host - the host DNS name or IP (do not include "ftp://").
        port - the port of the host listening for FTP connections (usually 21).

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPClientConfig config)
        Applies custom configurations to the FTPClient.
        See Also:
        FTPClient.configure(FTPClientConfig)

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Connects to and logs in the FTP server.
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SocketClient.connect(String, int), FTPClient.login(String, String)

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the FTP server.

      • getToStream

        public boolean getToStream(java.lang.String path,
                           java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                           int fileType)
        Retrieves the file at the given path from the server and writes it in the outputStream.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        outputStream - the OutputStream to which data is written.
        fileType - the type of the file (most common values are FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE and FTP.BINARY_FILE_TYPE).
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        FTPClient.setFileType(int), FTPClient.retrieveFile(String, OutputStream)

      • getToFile

        public boolean getToFile(java.lang.String path,
                         java.io.File file,
                         int fileType)
        Saves the file at the given path in the given File.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        file - the file to which data is written.
        fileType - the type of the file (most common values are FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE and FTP.BINARY_FILE_TYPE).
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        FileOutputStream, getToStream(String, OutputStream, int)

      • getStream

        @Nullable
public java.io.InputStream getStream(java.lang.String path,
                                               int fileType)
        Retrieves the InputStream to the file at the given path from the server.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        fileType - the type of the file (most common values are FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE and FTP.BINARY_FILE_TYPE).
        Returns:
        the opened InputStream or null in case of any error.
        See Also:
        FTPClient.setFileType(int), FTPClient.retrieveFileStream(String)

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String path)
        Retrieves the content of the file at the given path from the server as a String. The fileType is assumed FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE. NB: The maximum of the string is determined by maxReadSize, with default value of ~20MB. This value can be changed through setMaxReadSize(int).
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        Returns:
        the content of the file as a String.
        See Also:
        getStream(String, int), StreamReader.readStream(InputStream, int)

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes(java.lang.String path)
        Retrieves the content of the file at the given path from the server as a byte array. The fileType is assumed FTP.BINARY_FILE_TYPE. NB: The maximum of the string is determined by maxReadSize, with default value of ~20MB. This value can be changed through setMaxReadSize(int).
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        Returns:
        the content of the file as a byte array.
        See Also:
        getStream(String, int), StreamReader.readStream(InputStream, int)

      • putStream

        public boolean putStream(java.lang.String path,
                         java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                         int fileType)
        Uploads content of the given InputStream as a new file at the given path in the FTP server. If autoMKD is set to true (default), all necessary folders are created in the server if missing. This behaviour can be changed by calling enableAutoMkdirEnabled(boolean).
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        inputStream - the stream from which data is uploaded.
        fileType - the type of the file (most common values are FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE and FTP.BINARY_FILE_TYPE).
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        FTPClient.storeFile(String, InputStream)

      • putFile

        public boolean putFile(java.lang.String path,
                       java.io.File file,
                       int fileType)
        Uploads the given File at the given path in the FTP server.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        file - the file to which data is written.
        fileType - the type of the file (most common values are FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE and FTP.BINARY_FILE_TYPE).
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        putStream(String, InputStream, int)

      • putFile

        public boolean putFile(java.lang.String path,
                       java.io.File file)
        Uploads the given File at the given path in the FTP server as a binary file.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        file - the file to which data is written.
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        putFile(String, File, int)

      • putBytes

        public boolean putBytes(java.lang.String path,
                        byte[] bytes,
                        int fileType)
        Uploads the given bytes as a new file at the given path in the FTP server.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        bytes - the bytes to be uploaded.
        fileType - the type of the file (most common values are FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE and FTP.BINARY_FILE_TYPE).
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        putStream(String, InputStream, int)

      • putString

        public boolean putString(java.lang.String path,
                         java.lang.String string)
        Uploads the given String as a new file at the given path in the FTP server. FTP.ASCII_FILE_TYPE is assumed.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file on the server.
        string - the string to be uploaded.
        Returns:
        true in case of success, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        putBytes(String, byte[])

      • mkdir

        public boolean mkdir(java.lang.String path,
                     boolean recursive)
        Creates a new directory in the FTP server at the given path. If recursive is set to true, missing intermediate directory will be generated too. Otherwise, a missing directory in the path will cause the function to return false.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the new directory on the server.
        recursive - enable recursive mode.
        Returns:
        true if the directory has been created, false in case of errors.
        See Also:
        FTP.mkd(String), FTPClient.makeDirectory(String)

      • mkdir

        public boolean mkdir(java.lang.String path)
        Creates a new directory in the FTP server at the given path. All directories from the root must exist.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the new directory on the server.
        Returns:
        true if the directory has been created, false in case of errors.
        See Also:
        mkdir(String, boolean)

      • getMaxReadSize

        public int getMaxReadSize()
        Returns the currently set maximum read size.
        See Also:
        getBytes(String), getString(String)

      • setMaxReadSize

        public void setMaxReadSize(int maxReadSize)
        Sets the maximum read size.
        See Also:
        getBytes(String), getString(String)

      • isAutoMkdirEnabled

        public boolean isAutoMkdirEnabled()
        Returns true if automatic directory creation is enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        putStream(String, InputStream, int)

      • enableAutoMkdirEnabled

        public void enableAutoMkdirEnabled(boolean autoMKD)
        Enables or disables automatic directory creation.
        See Also:
        putStream(String, InputStream, int)
